title.value: Influence of sowing methods, seeding rates and pre-sowing seed treatment on quantitative expression of main yield structure elements of Japanese millet
Влияние способов посева, норм высева и предпосевной обработки семян пестицидами на количественное выражение основных элементов структуры урожая пайзы

journal.title: Arable Farming and Breeding in Belarus : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Tsygankova, A.V., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: In course of the research there was studied production process of Japanese millet (Echinochloa frumentacea) depending on cultivation methods. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in 2011-2012 on sod-podzolic loamy moderately cultivated soil in Grodno region. As a result of realized research there was revealed that the optimal parameters of the production process were obtained using row sowing method with seeding rate of 3 million seeds per hectare, and using wide-row method with 1.0-2.0 million germinable seeds per 1 ha, as well as using Kinto Duo, Baritone and complex of preparations for pre-sowing seed treatment. At the rank method of sowing with seed rate of 5.0 mln/ha and in wide-row method with a seeding rate of 3.0 mln/ha field germination was minimal values (respectively 60-61% and 70-71%). A significant decrease in field germination rate (on 7-9%) was observed at rank method of sowing and seeding rate increased from 3.0 to 5.0 million viable seeds per 1 ha. The use of disinfectants and growth regulating preparations for seed treatment had a positive effect on their germination: there was a significant advantage of all the options for the use of pesticides compared to the control.
